results.title: Fly through visualisations
results.brief_description: Collection of nine fly throughs using 3D visualisations of the Cinemedia complex at Federation Square. Some show plaza , most move from plaza through to ground floor and escalators.

results.title: Fluoridation
results.brief_description: Informational film made up almost entirely by static animated stills from the US Public Health Service as a plea for all communities to incorporate fluoride into water systems for the sake of the health of our teeth. Briefly explains why fluoride is so condusive to dental health.

results.brief_description: Explains the techniques of adding fluorescent colours to fabrics. Animation by Trever Bond; script by George Seager; edited by Roy Ayton.

results.title: Fluid
results.brief_description: Fluid is an abstract, miniature ecosystem made up of a handful of different species of organisms who live inside the computer screen. Fluid is also a game about systems, digital aesthetics and green ethics. The final objective of the game cleaning up the ecosystem!

results.title: Flowers in daily life
results.brief_description: Introduces the traditional Japanese art of flower arrangement including its historical and spiritual aspects. Shows the viewer a step-by-step guide to the daily art of flower arrangement.

results.title: Flinder's Journey
results.brief_description:
This film comments on Matthew Flinders’ journey and personal experiences of new Australian states and his fascination with native life.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Flight: an anthology
results.brief_description: An anthology of verse, prose, music and film about flying. In an age of technicalities and super-sonic developments, the film recaptures the basic freedom of getting above the clouds.

results.title: Flags = Zastave
results.creator_credit: Zoran Jovanovic, Nancy Karkowsky and Neoplanta Film
results.brief_description: Zoran Jovanovic, in simple line drawings, explores man’s complex relationship to one of his most important symbols - the flag. Only women, Jovanovic implies, see the flag not as symbol but as fabric. Animation by Predrag Pantovic and Slavomir Calic.

results.title: Five revolutionary painters: Van Gogh
results.brief_description: A review of this great painter’s life illustrated by his paintings, drawings and etchings. Through art he sought to perceive life. Caring little for society he depicted peasant life boldly. His feeling for detail is shown in the “Potato Eaters” and “At the gate of Eternity”. His self-portraits show him to be a nervous obstinate visionary. He used bright colors to show character. A wonderful understanding of drawing is shown in the picture of the Red boats in the South of France, where the brilliant light inspired him to paint. Narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark.

results.title: Five revolutionary painters: Rembrandt
results.brief_description: This film is about 17th Century Dutch painter Rembrandt. The son of a prosperous miller, Rembrandt was influenced by Caravaggio. This film is mainly about his etchings, most of which were done between 1639 and 1661. In particular we see his illustrations inspired by subjects in the Old and New Testaments. Illustrated by copies collected from Paris, Turin, Munich, Berlin and the Hague. Narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark.
